intro: Trigonostemon lanceolatus, commonly known as the narrow-leaf trigonostemon, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its botanical features include opposite leaf arrangement and a distinctive capsule fruit that splits open to release seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
